intro: Sidalcea oregana var. cusickii, commonly known as the Cusick's checkermallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows and hibiscus. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. Its flowers are pink to purple and have five petals, with a distinctive yellow center. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
